neighborhoods.name: Place Grenette
neighborhoods.character: Magnificent main square and historic heart of Grenoble, featuring elegant architecture and the iconic cable car to the Bastille
neighborhoods.location: Central Grenoble, the main square and surrounding area
neighborhoods.history: The heart of Grenoble since medieval times, this elegant square is surrounded by historic buildings, cafes, and the famous cable car station that leads to the Bastille fortress. It's the perfect starting point for exploring Grenoble's rich heritage and Alpine setting.

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by tram and bus

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Popular with tourists, locals, and those seeking cultural experiences
neighborhoods.tips: Visit during the day for the best light on the historic buildings. Take the cable car to the Bastille for spectacular mountain views. The area is pedestrian-friendly and perfect for exploring Grenoble's architectural heritage.

neighborhoods.name: Historic Center (Vieille Ville)
neighborhoods.character: Medieval heart of Grenoble with narrow cobblestone streets, historic buildings, and distinctive Alpine architecture
neighborhoods.location: Central Grenoble, the old town area
neighborhoods.history: The medieval core of Grenoble featuring narrow cobblestone streets, historic buildings, hidden courtyards, and distinctive Alpine architecture. The area is particularly atmospheric in the evening when the historic buildings take on a magical quality against the backdrop of the surrounding mountains.

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by tram and walking

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Essential for understanding Grenoble's history and culture
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and get the best photos. Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestone streets. The area is perfect for walking tours and cultural immersion.

neighborhoods.name: Place aux Herbes
neighborhoods.character: Authentic local market area with traditional Alpine atmosphere and fresh produce
neighborhoods.location: Central Grenoble, near the historic center
neighborhoods.history: Traditional covered market area offering authentic local experience with traditional Alpine products and foods. The market has served as the city's main food market for centuries, surrounded by historic buildings and a vibrant atmosphere.

practical_info.getting_there: Walking distance from center, accessible by tram
practical_info.safety: Safe during market hours, be aware of crowds

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Great for experiencing local culture and finding fresh food
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning for the freshest produce and most authentic experience. Bring cash for purchases. Be respectful when taking photos of vendors and their goods.

neighborhoods.name: Rue de la Poste
neighborhoods.character: Elegant historic street lined with beautiful buildings, boutique shops, and traditional restaurants
neighborhoods.location: Central Grenoble, connecting Place Grenette to the historic center
neighborhoods.history: One of Grenoble's most beautiful historic streets, lined with elegant buildings, boutique shops, and traditional restaurants. The street showcases Alpine architecture and is perfect for shopping, dining, and admiring the city's architectural heritage.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for shopping, evening for dining
practical_info.getting_there: Central location, walking distance from main attractions

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Excellent for shopping, dining, and architecture appreciation
neighborhoods.tips: This area is perfect for leisurely exploration. Take time to admire the architectural details of the historic buildings. Many shops and restaurants are closed on Sundays.

neighborhoods.name: Bastille
neighborhoods.character: Historic fortress area with spectacular mountain views and outdoor activities
neighborhoods.location: Above the city center, accessible by cable car
neighborhoods.history: Originally built as a fortress in the 19th century, the Bastille area offers spectacular panoramic views of Grenoble and the surrounding Alps. The cable car ride is a must-do experience, and the area features walking trails, restaurants, and outdoor activities.

practical_info.getting_there: Cable car from Place Grenette, hiking trails available

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Essential for spectacular views and outdoor activities
neighborhoods.tips: Take the cable car for the best experience. Visit during clear weather for the best mountain views. Bring comfortable shoes for walking the trails. Perfect for sunset photography.

neighborhoods.name: Saint-Laurent
neighborhoods.character: University district with vibrant student life, modern architecture, and cultural venues
neighborhoods.location: East of the city center, near the university
neighborhoods.history: A modern district developed around the University of Grenoble, featuring contemporary architecture, student housing, cultural venues, and a vibrant atmosphere. The area is known for its youthful energy and modern amenities.

practical_info.getting_there: Tram connections, walking distance from center

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Great for modern culture, student life, and contemporary architecture
neighborhoods.tips: Visit during the academic year to experience the vibrant student atmosphere. The area offers a contrast to the historic center with its modern architecture and contemporary culture.
